answer.answer: Covered if treated on IPD basis
No deduction in case of  death during hospitalization - including copay, NME (proportionate deduction only in case  of higher room rent than eligibility applicable as per policy terms)
In case of death of an employee, the dependents willbe continued to be covered till policy expiry provided they are not deleted from policy.
Hormonal chemotherapies covered in IPD/day care
Migration to retail policy is available for employees separating from Company as per IRDA guidelines
Treatment for sleep apnoea covered under IPD basis
Illness/injury due to hazardous activity covered, only hazardous sports under exclusion
Mental illness, stress or psychological disorders and neurodegenerative disorders stand covered
Treatment related to AMRD like intravitreal inj Avastin, Lucentis stand covered
Behavioural and Neurodeveloprnental Disorders like personality disorder, dyslexia

Expenses related to the surgical treatment of obesity are payable if advised by Dr, supported by clinical protocols, for age above 18 years, BMI > 40 or BMI> 35 with co morbidities like CHO, SSA, DM,  CMP, following failure of less invasive methods
Emergency, life threatening and accident cases payable upto stabilization
Medical condition of unknown aetiology stands covered
Failure to seek or follow medical advice or failure to follow treatment.
Expenses related to any admission primarily for enteral feedings
Pre/Post hospitalization cover under Domiciliary Treatment benent

gmcQuestionAnswers.question: Home care/treatment for Covid-19 claims & other pandemics

answer.answer: The patient should have been diagnosed with Covid-19/or similar pandemic disease  by a reputed/approved Diagnostic Centre.
The patient should be advised for home quarantine by a hospital or qualified medical practitioner
Coverage shall not be available for self home quarantine or self-medication.
Treatment exceeds 3 consecutive days, thene xpenses from Day 1 shall be covered
Cost of drugs prescribed by the attending Doctor/Hospital
Diagnostic Charges asprescribed by the attending Doctor/Hospital
Cost of Oximeter, Thermometer purchased during the period as per the advice and prescriptions of attending Doctor/Hospital
Expenses incurred for other lifesaving procedures/equipment as prescribed by attending Doctor/Hospital
Claim should be supported by prescriptions and original valid GST bills.
Whatever price/ Cost is fixed by ICMR/ Government, same to be adhered
